sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: This is Euronews Now. I'm Helena Humphrey. Here are your top stories.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Five Europeans are put on trial in separatist-controlled Ukraine, accused of being mercenaries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: They're denying the charges but could face the death penalty if found guilty.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Concerns Kenya could see widespread violence as some election officials and supporters of the outgoing president dispute William Ruto's victory in the presidential runoff. And a bid to protect the world's oceans. UN member states meet in New York hoping to finalize a treaty creating vast sanctuaries of protected waters.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Five Europeans captured in eastern Ukraine have gone on trial in a court run by Kremlin-backed separatists in the city of Donetsk. They come from Sweden, Croatia and the United Kingdom.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: All pleaded not guilty to charges of being mercenaries. If convicted, they could face the death penalty. In June, two Britons and a Moroccan, all of whom were captured by pro-Russian forces in Ukraine's industrial east, were sentenced to death on the same charge. They've appealed their verdicts.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: On another front, there's a growing dispute over Russians with visas being allowed to visit Europe. Ukraine wants a ban, saying being able to travel is not a God-given right when your government has invaded another country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The issue was raised at a meeting of Nordic leaders in Oslo, attended by German Chancellor Olaf Scholz, who found himself at odds with his counterparts.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: What is important for us is that we also understand that there are a lot of people fleeing from Russia because they are disagreeing with the Russian regime.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: All the decisions we take should not make it more complicated for them to go for freedom.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Ordinary Russian people didn't start the war, but at the same time we have to realize that they are supporting the war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: I think it's not right that Russian citizens can travel, enter Europe, Schengen area, be tourists, see the sightseens while Russia is killing people in Ukraine. It's wrong.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile in Ukraine, President Volodymyr Zelensky has welcomed American actor Liev Schreiber and former footballer Andrei Shevchenko. In Ukraine, President Volodymyr Zelensky has welcomed American actor Liev Schreiber and former footballer Andrei Shevchenko.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The pair are ambassadors for the Ukrainian fundraising platform United24.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The project was launched by Zelensky to centralize the collection of donations in support of the country. The fire in a temporary ammunition depot that sparked explosions in Russian-annexed Crimea

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: is an act of sabotage.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: That's according to Russia, however the perpetrators weren't named.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Two people are injured so far and thousands have been evacuated from the area.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: We are now seeing an official statement from the Ministry of Defence that today's emergency was caused by sabotage.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: We already understand what's going on.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: More than 3,000 people have already been evacuated from the villages of Mayskoi and Azovskoi.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: There are, of course, damaged houses.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: It was visible.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: There are several houses that have burned down.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: When we drove up to the depots, we could see several private homes on fire. We'll see. We're just not letting people into the perimeter zone. As soon as the detonation ceases, the commission will begin its work.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Russia say the fires caused damage to local infrastructure, like rail tracks and power lines. Meanwhile, an adviser to President Zelensky has called the explosions demilitarisation in action.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: William Ruto's victory in Kenya's presidential election is being welcomed internationally, and that is despite a dispute over the result. Now, with 50.5% of the vote, William Ruto only narrowly beat his rival, Raila Odinga. But yesterday's announcement was delayed amid scuffles at the results centre and allegations of vote rigging by Ryla Odinga's campaign. We're closely monitoring the latest developments is Michael O'Doar from our sister service, African News. Great to have you back with us, Michael. Yesterday when we saw that result declared, there was a mixture of celebration and also some scuffles, what appeared to be violent protests.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: What is the situation on the ground now, as you understand it?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Well, first of all, it's quite unfortunate what happened yesterday at the Bombers of Kenya, that is a national tally centre.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: But on the ground now, as you speak, clashes have at least gone down, I can say that.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The clashes actually erupted just immediately after the declaration by the abc the electoral commission chairman but these violence went a bit through the through the night but later on they subsided but this was actually expected especially in areas where raila odinga who is perceived to be having more supporters, like in Kisumu, which is in the western region part of Kenya, and also in Kibera slums, where you understand these are like strongholds of where Aila has more support.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: But generally in other areas and many regions of Kenya, Ruto's supporters were celebrating throughout the entire night.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Even some celebration went ahead till this morning, I consider.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And we've also now heard from Mr Ruto himself. What was his message to Kenyans? Throughout the entire night, even some celebration went ahead till this morning. I can see that.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And we've also now heard from Mr. Ruto himself.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: What was his message to Kenyans?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Well, it was very clear that Ruto was supporting and actually preaching peace.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: If you look at or listen or watch the entire speech that he had after his declaration, he was preaching peace, calling for unity in the entire nation. But at the same time, he also said he won't seek revenge against those who are against him. You remember his history well with the Huru Kinyata. Before they were very close friends, but later on things changed and they went apart. But himself, he said he's not going to seek revenge but is going to work as a president for everyone and that's what we're waiting to see maybe after if he is sworn in as president given the fact that if he is sworn in as a president because right now you understand we have several maybe some some petition coming in from Rai Lodinga the The division among the commissioners is not something that you can use in court legally because there are seven commissioners and we have the chairman who is the head of this commission.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: But then the chairman has the full mandate to declare the president.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: He has that full mandate.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: But these other six commissioners, they are just literally like workers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Of course, they have to work unanimously.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: But if there is a split, then it's not something that can hold waters in the court.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Russian President Vladimir Putin has hit out at the United States over the war in Ukraine and rising tensions in Taiwan.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Speaking at Russia's security conference in Moscow, Putin accused Washington of seeking to prolong the war and of fueling conflicts elsewhere in the world.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: As you know, the U.S. has recently once again made a deliberate attempt to add fuel to the fire and rock the situation in the Asia-Pacific region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: His speech follows a visit from a delegation of US Congress members to Taiwan's Parliament on Monday, showing their support for the self-governing island amid its tensions with China. In response, Putin accused the West of forming aggressive military political alliances. We also see that the collective West is seeking to extend its bloc system to the Asia-Pacific region, similar to NATO in Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: For this purpose, aggressive military-political alliances are being formed, such as AUKUS and others.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, China has staged fresh military drills near Taiwan, renewing its rhetoric that it would prepare for war over the self-ruled democracy that Beijing's leaders claim and vow to one day seize.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Brussels is holding its breath.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The EU said on Tuesday that it was examining Iran's response to its final proposal to resurrect the international agreement on Tehran's controversial nuclear programme.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: I can only confirm that we have received the Iranian response last evening. For the moment we are studying it and we are consulting with the other GCPOA participants and the US on the way forward.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: This is the result of years of tough negotiations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The pact on Tehran's nuclear program had originally hoped to allay Western fears that the Iranian regime would use its nuclear program as cover for producing atomic weapons.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: It came into force in 2015, but was abandoned three years later when the Trump administration decided to withdraw unilaterally and reimpose economic sanctions against Iran.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: But Joe Biden's arrival in the White House renewed hopes of reviving the agreement.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: And for the past 16 months, Germany, France, the UK, Russia, China and the US have all tried and failed to negotiate with Iran.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: During that time, its capacity to enrich uranium to develop atomic weapons has multiplied. And there's plenty more coming up after a short break. Do stay with us if you can.
